intro: Acoelorraphe arborescens, commonly known as the tree hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, featuring palmately lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in humid, shady environments.
